author: ghost
body:
# This is on Linux.

## Expected behavior

```none
PS ~/> 
```

## Actual behavior

```none
powershell: command not found
PowerShell: command not found
powershell-core: command not found
###############################
Command 'core' not found, did you mean:

  command 'cobe' from deb python-cobe
  command 'gcore' from deb gdb
  command 'more' from deb util-linux
  command 'care' from deb care

Try: sudo apt install <deb name>

```

## Environment data
This is maybe off topic but if it is, sorry about that. This is Powershell Core 7.0.1 I think.
I am on Linux Mint 19.3 Tricia x64 MATE. No LMDE or anything fancy. I just want to run powershell because I need to check hashes for a 32-bit Windows Image. `curl` (the linux command, not ps) always messes up.

All of the commands are in the attachment below:
[Commands.txt](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/4730884/Commands.txt)
The not working .deb file:
_Cannot Post!_
title: Command Not Found
